[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 76]
Reasoning: **My Game Plan: Ante 4, Shop Phase - Flush Focused**

Okay, here we are in the shop at Ante 4, Round 8, with $44 in my pocket. My primary goal is to keep my Flush build running smoothly and secure a win for future rounds. I have a solid Flush strategy centered around Clubs thanks to "The Moon," and I'm looking to optimize my Joker setup. Let's see...

I've got a decent lineup already: Gros Michel, Egg (worth $22 if I need the cash), Droll (a solid Flush multiplier), Perkeo (Legendary, clones consumables), and Crafty Joker (chips generator). The two Moons are a good setup for a Club-based strategy.

Perkeo's ability to create a negative copy of a consumable at the shop's end is crucial here. I have two Moons, which doesn't hurt me. It'll give me a third Moon, potentially offering me more flexibility in the coming rounds.

Now, let's evaluate the shop options. Earth (Planet, Full House) is irrelevant for this Flush-focused build. "Ride the Bus" is a no-go since my Flushes use face cards; the joker gets stronger when you don't play them. Standard and Mega Standard Packs are tempting, but I already have a Moon to get Clubs. The 'Magic Trick' voucher isn't particularly valuable right now unless I'm hunting for something very specific.

I have $44 to spend. Jupiter would be the ideal Planet card to level my Flush. Or better Jokers! I can sell the Egg to get more money if needed.

Reroll, here I come! It's only $3, and it's my best bet to find a Jupiter or a Joker.

A quick check on my Joker order: I need to maximize additive Mult, then xMult, then Chips. So: Gros Michel, Droll (with its Polychrome bonus and x1.5 multiplier), Perkeo, and Crafty. The Crafty is a Chips generator that will combine its Chips with the Multiplier Jokers to get a final score.

Before I reroll, I'm going to double-check Perkeo again. Yes, it creates a third Moon. I am solid in my planning.

Okay, let's see what's on the table after a reroll...

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

reasoning:
**Final Decision: Reroll for Value**

Okay, so here's the situation: Ante 4, Round 8, shop time. I'm sitting pretty with $32 and a Flush-focused deck, looking to power up before the Boss Blind. My current setup is decent, but I'm hunting for that Jupiter Joker or something truly game-changing.

I've got a solid foundation with Gros Michel, Droll (Polychrome!), Egg, Perkeo, and Crafty Joker. Two Moons, great for suit fixing. I'm really eyeing Jupiter for the Flush level-up to make the boss easier, but I'm also open to a Joker that can drastically scale my score.

I've already burned a couple of rerolls, so I'm at the $6 reroll price point now. A judgement, a Standard pack and a Mega Standard pack are staring at me, along with a Magic Trick voucher.

The "Judgement" card is tempting, as it creates a random Joker, but my Joker slots are full. I could sell Gros Michel or Crafty, but I don't want to. I'm prioritizing building a consistent, powerful hand. I'm calculating the expected damage per hand to make sure my economy doesn't get me killed in the long run.

I'm getting that sweet $5 interest, and a $6 reroll keeps me above the interest cap. I'm thinking of my Perkeo Joker - I have a plan with the Moons to help me get a good club hand with extra cards. Perkeo will create a new Moon at the end of the shop.

The Mega Standard Pack is tempting, as it lets me pick 2 of 5 cards from the pack, which will help deck consistency, but given my Moons, I don't need help with suit fixing.

My main plan for right now is to find a stronger Joker, since my calculation show I might struggle on the next Boss round.

I'm going to take the reroll and hope for a Jupiter or a better scaling Joker. It's the most efficient play here. I have a lot of money right now, and I can be aggressive, but I need to make sure I don't burn all my resources with poor actions.

Okay, let's do this one last time. Reroll!
